titles.title: A bill to authorize and direct the Secretary of the Interior to convey certain lands in Cameron Parish, Louisiana, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S2034)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from Department of the Interior, and Office of Management and Budget.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston without amendment. With written report No. 103-18.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 32.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with amendments by Voice Vote.

action.text: Received in the House.
Held at the desk.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Forests and Public Lands.

committee.name: House Committee on Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests and Public Lands

action.text: Subcommittee Hearings Held.

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Natural Resources

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended).
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 103-365.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 199.

action.text: Mr. Vento moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House amendment to Senate bill.
Senate agreed to the House amendment by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: Public Lands, National Parks and Forests

committee.name: House Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: National Parks, Forests, and Public Lands

bill.summary: 11/15/1993--Passed House amended. Directs the Secretary of the Interior to convey certain lands located in Cameron Parish, Louisiana, to the West Cameron Port Commission for use as a public port facility or for other public purposes, subject to reversion to the United States if such lands cease to be operated for such purposes, retention of the Calcasieu Pass Radio Beacon Site for the Coast Guard, retention of a U.S. permit for installation and maintenance of a tide gauge and height restrictions for a radio tower, and a reservation of minerals. Authorizes the Secretary to negotiate and enter into leases for all or part of the Letterman-LAIR complex at the Presidio of San Francisco to be used for scientific, research, or educational purposes. Requires the Secretary to use the proceeds from such lease for five years after the enactment of this Act for the preservation, restoration, operation, maintenance, improvement, repair, and related expenses incurred with respect to Presidio properties.
